body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.
body_html:
ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in guild_id. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

title: Since jason was banned just for mentioning someone's publically posted real name, then the admins should definitely get banned for ACTUALLY doxxing this user

author.bio:

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?
body_html:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

  1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

  2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

  3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

  4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

  5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

  6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

  1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

  2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

  3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

  4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

  5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not that active but that could just be luck)

  6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

  7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

  8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

  9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's no one in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And all the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

body: There, I said it. Those made-up snowflake tumblr genders are ridiculous. "fluid cat socialist bluehaired ahs snowflake" isn't a gender. You're either a boy or a girl (or in rare cases both or neither, but that's still combinations of the two).
body_html: There, I said it. Those made-up snowflake tumblr genders are ridiculous. "fluid cat socialist bluehaired ahs snowflake" isn't a gender. You're either a boy or a girl (or in rare cases both or neither, but that's still combinations of the two).

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
It's undeniable that the central tenets of the (US) conservatives used to be small, limited government, states rights, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, etc. With a few exceptions (such as the war on drugs and the death penalty), conservatives were basically a more moderate version of libertarian, and there was a lot of spillover from one to the other.

However in the past few years that has definitely changed. I haven't seen it in its purest form since about a decade ago or maybe even before that, but it's really picked up in the past 1-2 years. Conservatives are now suddenly demanding a strong state, control of the people, censorship, tough laws banning things they determined have a negative impact on society, more restricted individual rights, etc. They've basically become the left with a right-wing agenda. This was a really fast change and it's been shocking to me; I still have trouble believing it. What's the hardest is seeing all my conservative friends changing at once and suddenly going from mostly believers in freedom to solid authoritarians in a really short time. Their fundamental philosophy is such the opposite of what it was, and to me this major shift in thinking is a complete mystery. Ironically, they now closely resemble Joe Biden in his younger days of politics. Of course I still know of many people who believe in the old philosophy, but the majority of their former allies no longer do and now regard them as traitors. I can't wrap my head around what's going on here. Big brother is now watching you from both sides. So to the current conservatives out there, what made you decide this is necessary?
body_html:
It's undeniable that the central tenets of the (US) conservatives used to be small, limited government, states rights, individual liberty, free markets, free speech, etc. With a few exceptions (such as the war on drugs and the death penalty), conservatives were basically a more moderate version of libertarian, and there was a lot of spillover from one to the other.

However in the past few years that has definitely changed. I haven't seen it in its purest form since about a decade ago or maybe even before that, but it's really picked up in the past 1-2 years. Conservatives are now suddenly demanding a strong state, control of the people, censorship, tough laws banning things they determined have a negative impact on society, more restricted individual rights, etc. They've basically become the left with a right-wing agenda. This was a really fast change and it's been shocking to me; I still have trouble believing it. What's the hardest is seeing all my conservative friends changing at once and suddenly going from mostly believers in freedom to solid authoritarians in a really short time. Their fundamental philosophy is such the opposite of what it was, and to me this major shift in thinking is a complete mystery. Ironically, they now closely resemble Joe Biden in his younger days of politics. Of course I still know of many people who believe in the old philosophy, but the majority of their former allies no longer do and now regard them as traitors. I can't wrap my head around what's going on here. Big brother is now watching you from both sides. So to the current conservatives out there, what made you decide this is necessary?
